At Hope Hospital, we provide comprehensive care for patients with lung cancer, COPD, sleep issues, and cystic fibrosis, which includes bronchoscopy. With our fully furnished pulmonary function laboratory, we provide the highest caliber of care to our patients.

The superspecialty of pulmonology focuses on the prevention, detection, and treatment of respiratory and lung diseases. Asthma, pneumonia, tuberculosis, and other severe chest infections are among the illnesses that our doctors are qualified to treat.

Why choose Hope Hospitals for pulmonology?

Hope Hospitals offer a variety of services to support your pursuit of a healthy lifestyle in addition to comprehensive care for lung disorders. Our pulmonary specialists provide the solutions people need when they are dealing with significant and complex medical issues involving the lungs and breathing.

Our pulmonologists are interested in both clinical and basic research of the respiratory system, spanning from the structure of the respiratory epithelium to the best way to treat pulmonary hypertension.

Pulmonology diseases we treat

  • Pneumonia
  • Emphysema
  • Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
  • Asthma
  • Bronchitis
  • Diaphragm disorders
  • Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome
  • Lung cancer
  • Sleep disorders such as Narcolepsy, Sleep apnea and Insomnia
  • Interstitial lung disease
  • Pulmonary hypertension
  • Lung infection
  • Acute and chronic respiratory failure
  • Pulmonary fibriosis
  • Tuberculosis
  • Diphtheria

Hope Hospital services for Pulmonology

  • Lung cancer screening and management
  • Pulmonary rehabilitation program
  • Conventional and advanced mechanical ventilation for severe respiratory failure
  • Respiratory care and Pulmonary diagnostic services
  • Diagnosis and treatment of chronic respiratory disease, including COPD and asthma
  • Diagnosis and management of sleep disordered breathing

Treatment for Pulmonology

  • Polysomnography While the study, a device monitors your heart rate, respiration, blood oxygen level, eye and leg movements, and brain waves.
  • Lung Transplant is a surgical technique to swap out a sick or failing lung for a healthy lung, typically from a deceased donor.
  • Pulmonary Rehabilitation programme is a closely supervised medical programme that improves the lives and breathing of people with lung diseases. If you have a lung condition like chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, you might need pulmonary rehabilitation (COPD). You will learn workouts and breathing methods throughout the programme.
  • Video bronchoscopy is a treatment used to check for abnormalities in the airways, lungs, or lymph nodes in the chest and to treat diseases such abnormal growths or foreign objects obstructing the airways.
  • Endobronchial Ultrasound is a minimally invasive but remarkably successful method used to identify infections, lung cancer, and other conditions that expand the lymph nodes in the chest.
  • Comprehensive Hemoptysis Management 

Precautions for Healthy Lungs

  1. Don’t smoke, and don’t be around people who do.
  2. Pay attention to the air quality in your surroundings. If you are worried, check for toxins or pollutants and talk to your doctor about it.
  3. Frequently wash your hands with soap and water to prevent the spread of respiratory infections and the common cold 
  4. Steer clear of crowded areas during flu season or if you hear that another respiratory infection is spreading.
  5. To prevent infecting others with colds and respiratory infections, stay at home if you are ill.
  6. Obtain your yearly flu shot, and encourage your family members to do the same.
  7. Engage in regular cardiac activity to improve your general health and lung fitness.
  8. Perform activities to improve your diaphragmatic breathing.
  9. Maintain good dental and oral hygiene to stop hazardous microorganisms from entering your upper airway from your mouth.
  10. Visit your primary care physician regularly for checkups and address any concerns you may have regarding your lung health, including any signs of lung cancer and any family history of lung disease.

 

When should I see a doctor about my asthma?

You may have a serious case of bronchitis if the airway between your mouth, nose, and lungs becomes blocked and your bronchial tubes are inflamed or swollen. Children who have a persistent cough or cold may develop acute bronchitis, while older persons may experience breathing difficulties if treatment is delayed. You should see a doctor if

  • You have a high temperature that is greater than 101 degrees.
  • Sleeping difficulties 
  • Coughing up blood gasping for air
  • You are generating any mucus that is coloured

 

What is the difference between a pulmonologist and a chest surgeon?

While a chest surgeon focuses on surgical treatments involving the heart, lungs, esophagus, and other chest organs, a pulmonologist specializes in diagnosing and treating illnesses that impact the lungs and respiratory system.

 

What is the treatment for chronic obstructive pulmonary disease?

If you smoke, giving it up will decrease the advancement of COPD. The most frequently given medications are short- and long-acting bronchodilators, which come in the form of inhalers. Your doctor can suggest a pulmonary rehabilitation program that consists of physical activities, illness management instruction, and dietary and psychological counseling. Oxygen therapy may be used in extreme situations to help with shortness of breath, and very occasionally, surgery may be advised.

 

Is Asthma deadly?

If asthma is not adequately managed or cared for, it can be deadly. According to studies, one-third of those who died from asthma had a mild form of the condition. As a result, it’s crucial to manage your asthma and make every effort to limit your exposure to contaminated air.

 

What are tests for pulmonary function?

These include various exams that evaluate how effectively the lungs function. Spirometry is the most basic examination. The volume of air the lungs can contain is determined by this test. The lung capacity test, gas  effusion test,exercise stress test and additional examinations.
